title: ESG exclusive 'club' puts pressure on agriculture - AgUpdate
summary: The increasing popularity of ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) has the potential to reshape farming and agriculture. However, the subjectivity and arbitrariness of ESG metrics have raised concerns about their impact on farmers and the market, particularly in the livestock industry. To mitigate these concerns, farmers and agricultural organizations should engage with policymakers, carefully review contracts, and be vigilant about ESG-related language in financial disclosures.
greenwashing: ESG has been criticized as a form of greenwashing due to its subjective and arbitrary nature, allowing companies to present themselves as environmentally friendly without making substantial changes to their practices.

title: Koch Engineered Solutions and Percepto Join Forces To Bring - CSRwire.com
summary: Koch Engineered Solutions (KES) has partnered with Percepto to offer Percepto's autonomous drone and AI software solutions to industrial customers. Percepto's technology can be used to monitor and reduce emissions, as well as improve safety and efficiency. The partnership will allow KES to offer new cutting-edge services to its customers that can help them meet their environmental and business goals.

title: ADM invests over $30m in new facility in Spain to meet growing demand for probiotics - FeedNavigator.com
summary: ADM has completed construction of a $30 million production facility in Spain that will allow it to produce both probiotics and postbiotics on the same site, increasing its production capacity to 50 metric tons and supply growing markets for both in the US, Asia-Pacific, and Europe. ADM said the capacity expansion will help it realize its ambition to increase health and wellness revenue from over $500m in 2022 to $2bn within 10 years. The new facility is located close to ADM’s R&D center in the University of Valencia Scientific Park, where its scientists undertake activity including next-generation genome sequencing and early-stage testing of new bacterial strains.
green_innovation: TRUE. The probiotic and postbiotic products produced at this new facility are green innovations because they are designed to reduce negative externalities of the agricultural industry by promoting animal health and resilience, and therefore, reducing the number of animals that must be raised and slaughtered to meet protein demands.
business_innovation: TRUE. The new facility uses new technologies next-generation genome sequencing and early-stage testing of new bacterial strains to produce probiotics and postbiotics. It also represents a significant increase in the company's production capacity, which will allow it to supply growing markets for probiotics and postbiotics in the US, Asia-Pacific, and Europe.
green_product: TRUE. The probiotics and postbiotics produced at this new facility can be considered green products because they are designed to reduce negative externalities of the agricultural industry by promoting animal health and resilience, and therefore, reducing the number of animals that must be raised and slaughtered to meet protein demands.
green_process: TRUE. The facility incorporates new technologies like next-generation genome sequencing and early-stage testing of new bacterial strains to produce probiotics and postbiotics, which can be considered a green process.

title: Here's what won’t be included in Nassimi’s performance fabrics - Home Accents Today
summary: Textile manufacturer Nassimi has eradicated all PFAS chemicals from its new production. Nassimi said his company has always been at the forefront of sustainable manufacturing, engineering its fabrics to be PFAS-free from the beginning. As an example, Nassimi’s Supreen liquid barrier fabrics use a silicone-based stain repellent that is applied following a patented fabric-purification process.
product_or_process: Supreen, Writer’s Block polyurethanes, SiO silicones and Resilience faux leathers
likely_naics_codes: ['313311 Broadwoven Fabric Mills', '313221 Narrow Fabric Mills', '313312 Woven Carpet and Rug Mills', '314110 Carpet and Rug Mills']

title: Krill diet fulfills choline requirements and supports better intestinal and liver health in salmon - Aquafeed.com
summary: A new study has shown that krill meal and krill oil are effective in reducing intestinal steatosis in farmed Atlantic salmon. The study was conducted by researchers at the Norwegian University of Life Sciences and Aker BioMarine. The findings suggest that krill is a functional ingredient that can significantly improve the nutritional quality of the dietary feed, leading to better quality products.
likely_naics_codes: ['311711 - Seafood Canning', '311712 - Fresh and Frozen Seafood Processing', '311999 - All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing', '311421 - Aquaculture']

title: MSD Animal Health set to launch revamped platform to predict poultry health, prevent disease and improve performance - FeedNavigator.com
summary: MSD Animal health, a company with a large poultry vaccine portfolio, has acquired SenseHub, a technology that allows poultry farmers to continuously track and analyze the overall health performance of their flocks. The platform combines biopharma and technological solutions to help customers detect disease early in their flocks and act on it, thereby boosting bird health and efficiency. The platform is connected to the cloud, providing farmers with access to real-time data 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
green_innovation: TRUE; SenseHub Poultry is an innovation that contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing resource consumption and improving the overall health performance of poultry flocks.
business_innovation: TRUE; SenseHub Poultry is a new business process for the poultry farming industry that differs significantly from previous business processes and has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: FALSE; The article does not describe a green product.
green_process: FALSE; The article does not describe a green process.
